meanings.definition: To give up or renounce a position or membership.
meanings.sent1: She demits her role as team captain.
meanings.sent2: He demits his membership in the club.
meanings.sent3: The cat demits its duty to catch mice and decides to nap instead.
meanings.sent4: After years of service, the old tree demits its leaves gracefully in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent5: The student demits his seat in the front row and moves to the back of the class.

meanings.definition: To resign or relinquish a duty or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: The manager demits his position to pursue a new career.
meanings.sent2: She demits her role as treasurer of the organization.
meanings.sent3: The robot demits its task of cleaning and starts dancing instead.
meanings.sent4: The sun demits its duty to shine on the rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The tired athlete demits his responsibility to train and takes a break instead.
